title: Oil Market Faces Biggest Supply Crisis in Decades Unless OPEC Boosts Output, IEA Says
sub_head: Three million barrels a day of Russian oil output could be lost from April because of sanctions, agency says
body:
Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine and Western sanctions on its oil exports threaten a supply shock that will weigh on the global economy and tighten energy markets even further unless major producers increase output, according to the International Energy Agency.
Energy markets were facing the biggest supply crisis in decades, which could result in lasting changes, the Paris-based agency said Wednesday in its monthly report.
